result.execSummary:
The defendant Paula A Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IF REVOKED: Huber with all standard release conditions

miscConds.notes:
*Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
*If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Restitution for Walmart to be paid as a condition of probation

*Complete Criminal thinking course
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
*No contact with any Walmart store

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paula A Williams

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty. Steven Hughes

2:29 PM Defendant Paula A Williams in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Paula A Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 

Court orders the following:
60 DAYS  Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.
STAYED for PROBATION

Term of Probation: 1 YEAR
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 Criminal Thinking Course
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 No contact with:  any Walmart Store
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  $1931.66 owed to Walmart (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
COSTS:  $243.00
DRGOD:$10.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Def signed Signature Bond 8/25

Defendant failed to sign signature bond as ordered by the Court. Upon signing of the $500.00 signature bond, warrant may be quashed and defendant released. 
EXT 3

Defendant failed to sign signature bond as ordered by the Court. Upon signing of the $500.00 signature bond, warrant may be quashed and defendant released. 
EXT 3
Hearing on September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Walmart listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

1:03 PM Defendant Paula A Williams in court. The Court excuses the Defendant's appearance, as she is not feeling well.  Attorney Eryn Menden for attorney Steven Hughes in court for Paula A Williams.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Hughes is appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  
Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Check Case scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 07:45 am.

10:19 AM Defendant Paula A Williams not in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the defendant contacted the Clerk's Office indicating she is sick and did not receive a copy of the summons and complaint.  No objection by the State to adjourn.  The Court will adjourn the initial appearance.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant called this morning, saying she would not make it to being sick and she never received summons due to moving. Court updated her address and number phone number.
